\n\nGolden Waffle Breakfast Sandwich@Tue.recipe:
Ingredients: 
- 2 eggs
- 2 waffles
- 6 slices bacon

Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
3. Place the bacon on the baking sheet and bake in preheated oven for 12-14 minutes, or until crispy. 
4. Meanwhile, in a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat, scramble the eggs until they are cooked through.
5. Place the waffles in a toaster and toast until golden brown.
6. Plate the eggs, waffles, and bacon and serve. Enjoy!
\n\nGolden Waffle Breakfast Sandwich@Tue.title: Golden Waffle Breakfast Sandwich

\n\nTomato Egg Skillet@Mon Dec 04 22:24:.recipe:
Ingredients:
1 Tomato
2 Eggs
1/4 teaspoon Salt
1/4 teaspoon Pepper
1 tablespoon Olive Oil

Instructions:
1. Start by heating olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. 
2. Cut the tomato into quarter slices and add them to the skillet. 
3. Cook the tomato slices until lightly browned. 
4. Crack the eggs into a bowl, then add salt and pepper to the eggs. 
5. Add the egg mixture to the skillet and reduce the heat to medium-low. 
6. Stir the egg and tomato until the eggs are cooked and there are no raw egg pieces visible. 
7. Serve the egg and tomato dish hot. Enjoy!
\n\nTomato Egg Skillet@Mon Dec 04 22:24:.title: Tomato Egg Skillet

\n\nTomato Mushroom Asparagus Medley@Tue.recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 tomatoes, chopped
- 3 cups of mushroom, chopped
- 2 bunches of asparagus, chopped into 1-inch pieces
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.

2. In a large bowl, toss together tomatoes, mushrooms, and asparagus.

3. Drizzle olive oil over the vegetables and season with salt and pepper.

4. Spread the vegetables on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until vegetables are fork tender.

5. Serve warm. Enjoy!
\n\nTomato Mushroom Asparagus Medley@Tue.title: Tomato Mushroom Asparagus Medley

\n\nTomato and Olive Medley@Tue Dec 05 2.recipe:
Ingredients:

- 3 Ripe Tomatoes
- 1 Handful of Pitted Olives
- 1 Clove of Garlic (Minced)
- 1/4 Cup of Olive Oil
- A Pinch of Salt
- 1/4 Cup of White Wine
- 1/2 Teaspoon of Oregano
- 1/4 Teaspoon of Black Pepper
- 1/2 Cup of Feta Cheese (Crumbled)

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.

2. Cut the tomatoes into small cubes and place into an oven-safe dish.

3. Add the olives, garlic, olive oil, salt, white wine, oregano, and black pepper to the dish and mix together to combine.

4. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes.

5. Remove from heat and top with Feta cheese crumbles.

6. Enjoy!
\n\nTomato and Olive Medley@Tue Dec 05 2.title: Tomato and Olive Medley

\n\nCrispy You Tacos@Tue Dec 05 18:10:50.recipe:
Ingredients:
-1 can of chickpeas
-1/2 cup of couscous
-2 tablespoons olive oil
-1 bell pepper
-1/4 cup chopped onions
-2 cloves garlic, minced
-2 cups vegetable broth 
-1 teaspoon ground cumin
-1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
-1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes
-Salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
1. Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
2. Add the onions and bell pepper and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the veggies start to soften.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional minute.
4. Add the couscous, cumin, smoked paprika, red pepper flakes, and vegetable broth. Stir everything together, bring to a boil, and reduce to a simmer.
5. Simmer for 10-12 minutes until the couscous is cooked.
6. Drain and rinse the chickpeas and add them to the pot. 
7. Simmer for an additional 5 minutes until everything is heated through.
8. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve warm and enjoy!
\n\nCrispy You Tacos@Tue Dec 05 18:10:50.title: Crispy You Tacos

\n\nBacon and Ham Sandwich@Mon Dec 04 22.recipe:
Ingredients needed:
1-4 slices of Bacon 
1-2 slices of Ham 
2 slices of Bread 
Optional:
Mayonnaise
Mustard

Instructions:
1. Heat up the skillet on medium heat. 
2. Lay the bacon strips in the skillet and cook until both sides are lightly browned. 
3. After the bacon is done, set it aside and add the ham to the same skillet. 
4. Cook the ham until lightly browned, flipping it over once during the cooking process. 
5. Toast the two slices of bread in a toaster or a toaster oven.
6. Assemble the sandwich by spreading a thin layer of mayonnaise and/or mustard (one or both depending on preference) on each slice of bread.
7. Place the bacon and ham on one slice of bread and top it off with the other slice of bread. 
8. Enjoy your bacon and ham sandwich!
\n\nBacon and Ham Sandwich@Mon Dec 04 22.title: Bacon and Ham Sandwich

\n\nGrilled Steak and Rice Bowl@Tue Dec.recipe:
Ingredients:

- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 pound steak, cubed
- 2 cups long grain white rice
- 2 tablespoons tomato paste
- 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
- 2 cups beef broth
- 2 cups water
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- Salt and pepper, to taste

Instructions:

1. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.

2. Add cubed steak and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.

3. Add the rice, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, beef broth, water, paprika, and salt and pepper. Stir well to combine.

4. Turn the heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil.

5. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and cover. Simmer for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.

6. Fluff the rice with a fork before serving. Enjoy!
\n\nGrilled Steak and Rice Bowl@Tue Dec.title: Grilled Steak and Rice Bowl

\n\nSavory Chicken and Egg Breakfast Bo.recipe:
Ingredients:

2 chicken breasts, diced
2 eggs
1 teaspoon of olive oil
Salt and pepper, to taste

Instructions:

1. Heat the olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.

2. Add the diced chicken to the pan and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes, until the chicken is thoroughly cooked through.

3. Crack the eggs into the pan with the chicken. Stir together gently and cook for 2-4 minutes, until eggs are cooked and fluffy.

4. Serve the chicken and egg scramble with a side of toast. Enjoy!
\n\nSavory Chicken and Egg Breakfast Bo.title: Savory Chicken and Egg Breakfast Bowl

\n\nHam and Egg Breakfast Skillet@Tue De.recipe:
Ingredients:

-ham
-eggs
-dijon mustard
-butter
-salt 
-white pepper

Instructions:

1. Preheat oven to 375°F.

2. Cut ham into thin slices and set aside.

3. Heat a large skillet over medium heat, and add butter.

4. Once the butter is melted add ham slices and sauté until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.

5. In a bowl, crack eggs and beat with a whisk until mixed.

6. Pour egg mixture into pan with ham and reduce heat to low.

7. Stir the egg mixture constantly with a spatula until eggs begin to scramble.

8. Once eggs are scrambled, season with a pinch of salt and white pepper.

9. Spread the egg and ham mixture evenly in the skillet.

10. Dollop ½ teaspoon of Dijon mustard onto the mixture and swish with the back of a spoon.

11. Place skillet in the oven, and bake for 15 minutes.

12. Serve eggs and ham warm with buttered toast. Enjoy!
\n\nHam and Egg Breakfast Skillet@Tue De.title: Ham and Egg Breakfast Skillet

\n\nSavory Tomato and Egg Bake@Tue Dec 0.recipe:
Ingredients: 
- 4 eggs
- 2 tomatoes
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 1 teaspoon of garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon of onion powder
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions: 
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
3. Crack the eggs into the skillet and season with garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Stir constantly until the eggs are cooked through.
4. Slice the tomatoes into thin slices and add them to the skillet. Continue to cook until tomatoes are softened.
5. Grease an 8x8 baking dish and add the egg and tomato mixture into the dish.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the eggs are set and lightly browned.
7. Serve and enjoy!
\n\nSavory Tomato and Egg Bake@Tue Dec 0.title: Savory Tomato and Egg Bake
